log.input: # Velocity Selector## Description of Physical Motion  A velocity selector is a device used to filter charged particles with specific velocities. The basic structure consists of two parallel charged plates generating a uniform downward electric field, combined with a perpendicular magnetic field directed into the plane of the paper. When positively charged particles enter the velocity selector horizontally from the left at speed \(v\), they experience a downward electric force and an upward magnetic force. If these forces cancel out (resulting in zero net force), the particle moves at a constant velocity in a straight line.  By adding a blocking plate with a small aperture on the right, only particles moving in a straight line can pass through. This allows the velocity of the particles passing through to be controlled by adjusting the strengths of the electric and magnetic fields.  ### Key Simulation Features (Program 20-1)- Visualizes the electric field, magnetic field, parallel charged plates, and the trajectory of a charged particle.- The particle stops moving upon collision with the charged plates.The simulation clearly demonstrates the motion of particles under various force combinations, even with adjusted parameters to simplify visualization (e.g., increased particle mass to reduce acceleration).  ## Conclusion  The velocity selector simulation effectively illustrates the interplay between electric and magnetic forces on charged particles, making it an excellent educational tool to understand particle motion dynamics in electric and magnetic fields.
log.output:
from vpython import *

scene.caption = "Velocity Selector Simulation"

# Constants
q = 1.6e-19  # charge of particle (C)
m = 1e-27    # mass of particle (kg)
v = 1e6      # speed of particle (m/s)
B = 5        # magnetic field strength (T)
E = 1        # electric field strength (V/m)
L = 2e-2     # distance between plates (m)

# Setup scene
scene.width = 800
scene.height = 400
scene.range = 0.1
scene.center = vector(0, L/2, 0)

# Create charged plates
plate1 = box(pos=vector(-L/2, 0, 0), size=vector(0.01, L, L), color=color.blue)
plate2 = box(pos=vector(L/2, 0, 0), size=vector(0.01, L, L), color=color.blue)

# Create magnetic field
magnetic_field = arrow(pos=vector(0, L/2, 0), axis=vector(0, 0, -0.05), color=color.red)

# Create electric field
electric_field = arrow(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), axis=vector(1, 0, 0), color=color.green)

# Create particle
particle = sphere(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), radius=0.005, color=color.yellow, v=vector(v, 0, 0), a=vector(0, 0, 0))

# Time evolution
dt = 1e-9
while True:
    rate(100000)
    
    # Update particle position
    particle.pos += particle.v * dt

    # Calculate forces
    F_electric = q * E
    F_magnetic = q * particle.v.mag * B
    F_net = F_electric - F_magnetic

    # Calculate acceleration
    a = F_net / m

    # Update particle velocity
    particle.v += a * dt

    # Check for collision with plates
    if L/2 - particle.pos.y <= 0 or particle.pos.y + L/2 <= 0:
        particle.v = vector(0, 0, 0)

log.output:
from vpython import *

scene.caption = "Velocity Selector Simulation"

# Constants
q = 1.6e-19  # charge of particle (C)
m = 1e-27    # mass of particle (kg)
v = 1e6      # speed of particle (m/s)
B = 5        # magnetic field strength (T)
E = 1        # electric field strength (V/m)
L = 2e-2     # distance between plates (m)

# Setup scene
scene.width = 800
scene.height = 400
scene.range = 0.1
scene.center = vector(0, L/2, 0)

# Create charged plates
plate1 = box(pos=vector(-L/2, 0, 0), size=vector(0.01, L, L), color=color.blue)
plate2 = box(pos=vector(L/2, 0, 0), size=vector(0.01, L, L), color=color.blue)

# Create magnetic field
magnetic_field = arrow(pos=vector(0, L/2, 0), axis=vector(0, 0, -0.05), color=color.red)

# Create electric field
electric_field = arrow(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), axis=vector(1, 0, 0), color=color.green)

# Create particle
particle = sphere(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), radius=0.005, color=color.yellow, v=vector(v, 0, 0), a=vector(0, 0, 0))

# Time evolution
dt = 1e-9
while True:
    rate(100000)
    
    # Update particle position
    particle.pos += particle.v * dt

    # Calculate forces
    F_electric = q * E
    F_magnetic = q * particle.v.mag * B
    F_net = F_electric - F_magnetic

    # Calculate acceleration
    a = F_net / m

    # Update particle velocity
    particle.v += a*dt/m

    # Check for collision with plates
    if L/2 - particle.pos.y <= 0 or particle.pos.y + L/2 <= 0:
        particle.v = vector(0, 0, 0)

from vpython import *

scene.caption = "Velocity Selector Simulation"

# Constants
q = 1.6e-19  # charge of particle (C)
m = 1e-27    # mass of particle (kg)
v = 1e6      # speed of particle (m/s)
B = 5        # magnetic field strength (T)
E = 1        # electric field strength (V/m)
L = 2e-2     # distance between plates (m)

# Setup scene
scene.width = 800
scene.height = 400
scene.range = 0.1
scene.center = vector(0, L/2, 0)

# Create charged plates
plate1 = box(pos=vector(-L/2, 0, 0), size=vector(0.01, L, L), color=color.blue)
plate2 = box(pos=vector(L/2, 0, 0), size=vector(0.01, L, L), color=color.blue)

# Create magnetic field
magnetic_field = arrow(pos=vector(0, L/2, 0), axis=vector(0, 0, -0.05), color=color.red)

# Create electric field
electric_field = arrow(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), axis=vector(1, 0, 0), color=color.green)

# Create particle
particle = sphere(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), radius=0.005, color=color.yellow, v=vector(v, 0, 0), a=vector(0, 0, 0))

# Time evolution
dt = 1e-9
while True:
    rate(100000)
    
    # Update particle position
    particle.pos += particle.v * dt

    # Calculate forces
    F_electric = q * E
    F_magnetic = q * particle.v.mag * B
    F_net = F_electric - F_magnetic

    # Calculate acceleration
    a = F_net / m

    # Update particle velocity
    particle.v += a*dt/m

    # Check for collision with plates
    if abs(L/2 - particle.pos.y) <= 0 or abs(particle.pos.y + L/2) <= 0:
        particle.v = vector(0, 0, 0)

magnetic_field = arrow(pos=vector(0, L/2, 0), axis=vector(0, 0, -0.05), color=color.red)

# Create electric field
electric_field = arrow(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), axis=vector(1, 0, 0), color=color.green)

# Create particle
particle = sphere(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), radius=0.005, color=color.yellow, v=vector(v, 0, 0), a=vector(0, 0, 0))

# Time evolution
dt = 1e-9
while True:
    rate(100000)
    
    # Update particle position
    particle.pos += particle.v * dt

    # Calculate forces
    F_electric = q * E
    F_magnetic = q * mag(particle.v) * B
    F_net = F_electric - F_magnetic

    # Calculate acceleration
    a = F_net / m

    # Update particle velocity
    particle.v += a*dt/m

    # Check for collision with plates
    if L/2 - particle.pos.y <= 0 or particle.pos.y - L/2 <= 0:
        particle.v = vector(0, 0, 0)

log.output:
from vpython import *

scene = canvas(title="Velocity Selector Simulation", width=800, height=400, range=0.1, center=vector(0, L/2, 0))
scene.caption = "Velocity Selector Simulation"

# Constants
q = 1.6e-19  # charge of particle (C)
m = 1e-27    # mass of particle (kg)
v = 1e6      # speed of particle (m/s)
B = 5        # magnetic field strength (T)
E = 1        # electric field strength (V/m)
L = 2e-2     # distance between plates (m)

# Create charged plates
plate1 = box(pos=vector(-L/2, 0, 0), size=vector(0.01, L, L), color=color.blue)
plate2 = box(pos=vector(L/2, 0, 0), size=vector(0.01, L, L), color=color.blue)

# Create magnetic field
magnetic_field = arrow(pos=vector(0, L/2, 0), axis=vector(0, 0, -0.05), color=color.red)

# Create electric field
electric_field = arrow(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), axis=vector(1, 0, 0), color=color.green)

# Create particle
particle = sphere(pos=vector(-L/2, L/2, 0), radius=0.005, color=color.yellow, v=vector(v, 0, 0), a=vector(0, 0, 0))

# Time evolution
dt = 1e-9
while True:
    rate(100000)
    
    # Update particle position
    particle.pos += particle.v * dt

    # Calculate forces
    F_electric = q * E
    F_magnetic = q * particle.v.mag * B
    F_net = F_electric - F_magnetic

    # Calculate acceleration
    a = F_net / m

    # Update particle velocity
    particle.v += a*dt/m

    # Check for collision with plates
    if L/2 - particle.pos.y <= 0 or particle.pos.y + L/2 <= 0:
        particle.v = vector(0, 0, 0)
